content: african flower jellyfish by kellzbellz creations you will need ​ 4 colors of #4 worsted weight yarn ie redheart size j # 10 6 00mm crochet hook yarn needle scissors polyfil stuffing stitches and abbrevations single_crochet­ single_crochet half_double_crochet­ half_double_crochet double_crochet­ double_crochet treb­ treble_crochet st­ stitch chain­ chain decrease­ decrease slipst­ slip_stitch f/o­ fasten_off r­ round hello everyone this pattern is my thank you to all the patterns out there provided for free i hope you all enjoy this pattern is created in the round and slip stitching to join i usually start by chaining up to the stitch needed but not counting it as a stitch crown ​ with color a r1­ 4sc into magic_ring r2­ 2dc ch1 2dc in each st around 8dc+8ch1 f/o color a starting in ch1 space with color b r3­ 2dc ch2 2dc in each chain space 8 2dc ch2 2dc r4­ slipst to chain 2 space 7dc into each ch2 space around 8 7dc clusters f/o color b r5­ starting with color c *1sc into each of the next 7 st 1dc down around r3 between 2 2dc ch2 2dc clusters* x 7 56 single_crochet + 8 double_crochet f/o color c r6­ starting with color d 1dc into each st around 64dc r7­ 1sc into each st around 64sc f/o color d r8­ with color b 1dc into each st around 64dc f/o color b r9­ with color c 1hdc in each st around 64 half_double_crochet f/o color c now we will be work the under side of the jelly r9 cont turn work over working on the wrong side fasten on color a to the 3rd bar of the half_double_crochet 1sc into each 3rd bar stitch around you should still have a count of 64sc around slipst to join and continue in color a to find the 3rd bar flip over your work on the wrong side there should be a free loop attach new color there and work into that stitch it will leave the v at the top of your half_double_crochet unworked https //m youtube com/watch v=d2nyqjzbfva check out this video for more help ​ r10­ we are going to start decreasing *double_crochet into next 6st 1dec into next 2 st* from here on this will be written out 6dc 1dec x 7 56dc start stuffing your jelly fish now and as you are decreasing r11­ 5sc 1dec x7 48sc r12­ 4dc 1dec x7 40dc r13­ 3sc 1dec x7 32sc r14­ working in the back loops only 2dc 1dec x7 24dc r15­ working in both loops 1sc 1dec x7 16sc r16­ 1 double_crochet decrease around 8dc stuff crown and closed up bottom under skirt ​ using color a fasten on the front loops of r14 r1­ 1dc into each st around 32dc r2­ 1dc into each st around 32dc r3­ you will be creating a small bump with the last row put your hook in the next stitch then down into the 3rd bar of r1 than single_crochet continue with this
